alert.note: Alert for Boone; Carroll; Gallatin; Kenton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 5:37PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL SWITZERLAND, CARROLL, KENTON, SOUTHERN BOONE AND GALLATIN COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM EDT... At 537 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Carrollton, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, half inch hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Florence, Independence, Erlanger, Edgewood, Elsmere, Villa Hills, Carrollton, Crescent Springs, Walton, Crestview Hills, Oakbrook, Burlington, Union, Crittenden, Vevay, Warsaw, Kentucky Speedway, Glencoe, Ghent and Sanders. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
